intro: Acanthocalycium formosum var. albispinum, commonly known as the White-spined Hedgehog Cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a succulent cactus characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in white, bristly spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and slow growth, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.

The plant is well adapted to harsh desert conditions, with its spiny structure providing protection from herbivores and reducing water loss. Due to its limited range, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native habitat.
